item.title: 大规模杀伤性武器是如何受到 ESG 投资者青睐的？
item.description:
欧洲后院战火纷飞，欧洲领导人不希望任何环境、社会和公司治理方面的顾虑妨碍他们引导私人资本投入足以抵御俄罗斯的军事威慑力量。【原文：

With war raging in its backyard, Europe’s leaders don’t want any ESG qualms to get in the way of steering private capital into a military deterrent strong enough to resist Russia.

】

item.title: 俄勒冈州和加利福尼亚州的野火蔓延，导致人员撤离
item.description: 加利福尼亚州葡萄酒之乡和俄勒冈州中部的野火一夜之间蔓延开来，导致数百人撤离，消防员周日在干燥、炎热的天气中努力控制火势。【原文：Wildfires in California wine country and Central Oregon grew overnight, prompting hundreds of evacuations as firefighters worked Sunday to try to contain the blazes amid dry, hot weather.】

item.title: 银行假日降雨来临前气温将升至近 30 华氏度
item.description: 在飓风艾琳的余威带来风雨之前，银行假日的气温预计将飙升至接近 30 摄氏度。【原文：Bank Holiday temperatures are expected to soar to near 30C before the remnants of Hurricane Erin bring wind and rain.】

item.title: 在飓风艾琳余波来袭之前，英国气温可能达到 30 摄氏度
item.description: 在飓风艾琳的残余给海岸带来风雨和巨浪之前，英国的气温可能会在银行假日周末达到 30 摄氏度。【原文：UK temperatures could hit 30C over the bank holiday weekend before the remnants of Hurricane Erin bring wind and rain along with big waves to the coast.】

item.title: 台湾重启核电站公投失败
item.description: 由于投票率不高，重启台湾核电站的公投失败了，这对一些团体在政府关闭所有反应堆后试图恢复原子能的努力造成了打击。【原文：A referendum to restart a Taiwan nuclear plant failed due to poor voter turnout, dealing a blow to attempts by some groups to revive atomic power after the government shut all reactors.】

item.title: 瑞典因向森林所有者支付碳付款而爆发气候斗争
item.description:
该倡议引发了一场更广泛的辩论，讨论树木是否更值得矗立而非砍伐

。【原文：

Initiative fuels a wider debate on whether trees are worth more standing than cut

】

item.title: 开发商保持谨慎，中国太阳能新增装机量进一步放缓
item.description: 7 月份，中国的太阳能装机继续放缓，因为开发商仍在谨慎等待 6 月份生效的新政策的更多细节，该政策可能会影响可再生能源的回报。【原文：China’s solar installation continued to slow in July, as developers remained cautious waiting for more details about a new policy that took effect in June and may affect renewable returns.】

item.title: 世界气候变化危机让游客寻求 "清凉假期
item.description: 创纪录的热浪、熊熊燃烧的野火和令人窒息的湿度正在改变世界旅游业，因为度假者正在努力应对气候变化带来的破坏。【原文：Record heat waves, blazing wildfires and oppressive humidity are transforming the world’s tourism industry as holidaymakers struggle to deal with the havoc wrought by climate change.】

item.title: 特朗普叫停奥斯特德风电项目，行业再遭重创
item.description: 特朗普政府已经叫停了丹麦 Orsted A/S 公司正在罗德岛海岸建造的海上风电场。【原文：The Trump administration has halted work on an offshore wind farm being constructed off the coast of Rhode Island by Denmark’s Orsted A/S.】

item.title: 巴西为 1,250 亿美元全球森林基金争取到亚马逊盟友
item.description:
在 11 月主办 COP30 气候峰会之前，该国正在推进基金计划。【原文：

The country is moving ahead with plans for the fund ahead of hosting the COP30 climate summit in November. 

】

item.title: 特朗普环保局免除炼油厂生物燃料混合任务
item.description: 特朗普政府允许一些炼油厂豁免在汽油和柴油中掺入可再生燃料的规定。【原文：The Trump administration granted some oil refineries exemptions from mandates requiring them to blend renewable fuels into gasoline and diesel.】

item.title: 太阳能装机量激增，中国隆基绿色收窄亏损
item.description: 中国太阳能巨头隆基绿色能源技术有限公司（Longi Green Energy Technology Co.【原文：Chinese solar giant Longi Green Energy Technology Co. posted a narrower first-half loss as a surge in solar panel installations helped limit the impact of industry overcapacity.】

item.title: 印度电网延迟威胁 70 亿美元太阳能项目
item.description: 据一个行业组织称，印度拉贾斯坦邦即将实施的价值超过 70 亿美元的太阳能项目停滞不前，因为保护一种本地鸟类的努力导致输电审批出现瓶颈。【原文：Upcoming solar projects valued at more than $7 billion in the Indian state of Rajasthan have stalled after conservation efforts to safeguard a native bird led to bottlenecks in transmission approvals, according to an industry group.】

item.title: 国家公园是美国电动汽车的最后疆域
item.description:
黄石公园和优胜美地终于出现了电动汽车的身影，但许多最大的公园都没有充电器，而且不久也不会有。【原文：

Yellowstone and Yosemite are finally on the map for electric cars, but many of the largest parks don’t have chargers and aren’t likely to soon.

】

item.title: 天气交易员正在为下一次德国风灾做对冲
item.description: 今年早些时候的长期风灾削减了公用事业公司的收益，此后，天气交易商正在加大赌注，以防德国下一场风平浪静。【原文：After a prolonged wind drought earlier this year that cut earnings at utilities, weather traders are ramping up bets to protect themselves against the next bout of calm conditions in Germany.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦继续对石油巨头征收 40 亿美元硫罚款
item.description: 哈萨克斯坦环境保护部告诉在该国运营的石油巨头，他们必须在 40 天内支付数十亿美元的硫污染罚款，这对几周前声称在此案中获胜的生产商来说是一个打击。【原文：Kazakhstan’s environmental-protection ministry told oil majors operating in the country they have 40 days to pay a multibillion-dollar fine for sulfur pollution, a blow to the producers who claimed victory in the case weeks ago.】

item.title: 乌干达考虑新建城市以缓解首都拥挤状况，Akon 提议仍有效
item.description: 乌干达计划在坎帕拉附近的一个地区建造一座新城，该地区毗邻乌干达向 R&B 歌手 Akon 提供的一平方英里开发用地，以缓解首都的拥堵状况。【原文：Uganda plans to build a new city in an area near Kampala that’s adjacent to a square mile it has offered to R&B singer Akon for development as it seeks to reduce congestion in the capital.】

item.title: 中国太阳能产业敦促加大力度解决产能过剩问题
item.description: 中国太阳能行业最高机构表示，企业应解决严重的产能过剩问题，遏制 "无序 "竞争，并敦促企业加强自律，以应对该行业的长期低迷。【原文：China’s top solar industry body said companies should address severe overcapacity and curb “disorderly” competition, urging stronger efforts at self-discipline to combat the sector’s prolonged downturn.】

item.title: 印度能源巨头支持核电推动清洁能源发展
item.description: 印度的顶级能源公司正在倡导使用核电来为这个世界第三大排放国去碳，同时警告说，反应堆产生的电力必须是人们负担得起的，才能替代煤炭。【原文：India’s top energy firms are advocating for nuclear power to decarbonize the world’s third-biggest emitter, while cautioning that electricity from reactors needs to be affordable to substitute coal.】

item.title: 更好的电力需求预测对印度实现可再生能源目标至关重要
item.description: 印度中央电力局主席甘希亚姆-普拉萨德（Ghanshyam Prasad）表示，印度若想在避免停电的同时向电网注入更多可再生能源，就必须改进预测电力需求的方式。【原文：India needs to improve the way it forecasts power demand if it wants to inject more renewable energy into the grid while avoiding blackouts, according to Ghanshyam Prasad, chairman of the Central Electricity Authority.】

item.title: 世界某些地区的森林会加剧全球变暖
item.description:
研究发现，裸露的反射地表在某些情况下可以更好地为地球降温。【原文：

Bare, reflective ground surfaces can do a better job cooling the planet in some cases, research finds.

】

item.title: 中国放宽对部分绿色项目的外资限制
item.description: 中国正在放宽对企业为气候相关项目筹集外资金额的限制，以遏制温室气体排放，促进经济发展。【原文：China is easing restrictions on the amount of foreign capital that companies can raise for climate-related projects, as it seeks to curb greenhouse gas emissions and bolster its economy.】

item.title: 联合国警告过热天气损害工人健康和生产力
item.description: 联合国周五发布的一项研究发现，随着全球气温持续上升，工人的生产率和健康面临的风险也在加剧。【原文：As global temperatures continue to rise, the risks to workers’ productivity and health also are worsening, a United Nations study released Friday found.】

item.title: 世卫组织称全球变暖正在削弱工人的生产力
item.description: 一份强调气候变化经济风险的报告指出，地球变暖正在影响工人的健康和生产率。【原文：A warming planet is weighing on workers’ health and productivity, according to a report highlighting the economic risks of climate change.】

item.title: 能阻止停电的 100 吨旋转质量块
item.description:
如何防止类似西班牙大停电事件再次发生？Bloomberg Green 的劳拉-米兰（Laura Millan）将与《零点报》共同探讨。【原文：

How can something like the Spanish blackout be prevented from happening again? Bloomberg Green’s Laura Millan joins Zero to discuss.

】

item.title: 英伟达敦促台湾在公投前拥抱核能
item.description: 据英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）称，核能对台湾来说是一个 "绝佳的选择"，因为这个科技制造中心对能源密集型人工智能的需求将激增。【原文：Nuclear power is an “excellent option” for Taiwan, as demand from energy-intensive artificial intelligence is set to skyrocket in the tech manufacturing hub, according to Nvidia Corp.】

item.title: 报告称澳大利亚公用事业太阳能热潮已达顶峰
item.description: 澳大利亚蓬勃发展的公用事业级太阳能产业可能已经达到顶峰，从而危及该国崇高的气候目标。【原文：Australia’s booming utility-scale solar industry may have already peaked, risking the country’s lofty climate goals.】

item.title: 加州野火迫使葡萄酒之乡的居民撤离
item.description: 周四，加州旅游小镇卡利斯托加（Calistoga）附近爆发了一场野火，导致附近的酒庄和一些乡村居民撤离。【原文：A wildfire erupted near the California tourist town of Calistoga on Thursday, prompting the evacuation of nearby wineries and some rural residences.】

item.title: 美国和中国正在阻挠印度冲击价值 7 万亿美元的太阳能大奖
item.description:
为了抓住机遇，成为全球太阳能发电领域的一支生力军，中国必须解决关税紧张问题，并修复仍然严重依赖中国政府的供应链。【原文：

To seize its opportunity to become a global force in solar power, nation must address tariff tensions and fix a supply chain still hugely reliant on Beijing.

】

item.title: 美国对风力涡轮机展开调查，为征收更多关税敞开大门
item.description: 特朗普政府已对进口风力涡轮机和零部件展开调查，这可能是对清洁能源部件征收更多关税的前兆。【原文：The Trump administration has launched an investigation into imported wind turbines and parts, a potential precursor to adding more tariffs on the clean-energy components.】
